meanings.definition: Capable of being corrupted or influenced to do wrong.
meanings.sent1: The young prince was easily corruptible by the evil advisor.
meanings.sent2: The corruptible official accepted bribes without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The corruptible robot kept following the wrong commands, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a corruptible computer, easily infected by malicious software.
meanings.sent5: The corruptible nature of power can lead even the noblest individuals astray.

meanings.sent1: The ancient scrolls were so corruptible that they crumbled at a touch.
meanings.sent2: The wooden ship was slowly becoming corruptible due to exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The corruptible fruit attracted swarms of fruit flies in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Time is a corruptible force, wearing down even the strongest structures.
meanings.sent5: The corruptible nature of memories fades with each passing year.
